messages.content: To identify stiction, refer to the provided image. A sigmoid or S-shaped curve in the graph suggests the presence of stiction. The more closely the shape resembles a sigmoid, the more severe the stiction.
<image>Is there stiction in this control loop?
Yes, stiction is detected in this control loop.
What leads you to that conclusion?
A sigmoid shape is evident in the image.

Use the provided image to detect stiction. If the graph shows a shape similar to a sigmoid or the letter S, it indicates the presence of stiction. The similarity of the shape correlates with the severity of stiction.
<image>Does this control loop have stiction?
Yes, stiction is present in this control loop.
Why do you think so?
The image shows a clear sigmoid shape.
Stiction can be identified by examining the provided image. A sigmoid or S-shaped curve in the graph is indicative of stiction. The closer the shape matches a sigmoid, the more severe the stiction.
<image>Is there stiction in this control loop?
No, this control loop does not show stiction.
Why do you think so?
No sigmoid shape is visible in the image.
